newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: CZECH SHIPPER PLANS DOMESTIC BOND ISSUE.
newsitem.headline: CZECH SHIPPER PLANS DOMESTIC BOND ISSUE.

text.p: The Czech river shipping company CS Plavba Labska a.s. has approved a domestic bond issue of up to one billion crowns and chose investment firm Stratego Invest to arrange the issue and choose a lead manager, Stratego said.
Vladislav Svoboda, corporate finance director at Stratego, told Reuters that the issue had been approved by Plavba Labska's board of directors, but further details were not yet available.
The Decin-based shipper posted a net profit last year of 26 million crowns, down from 54 million crowns the previous year.
Major shareholders of the firm include members of the YSE investment group with 26 percent, the Czech investment fund SPIF Cesky with 16 percent and YSE Holding with 10 percent.
